name: Sofia Martinez
chief_complaint: Shortness of breath episodically with exertion and nighttime cough. Chest tightness after a recent upper respiratory infection.
history: Mild intermittent asthma since adolescence. Uses albuterol inhaler as needed. No hospitalizations. Non-smoker.
red_flags: No hemoptysis, no syncope, no chest pain on rest. No DVT/PE history.
vitals: BP 112/70, HR 76, RR 18, SpO2 98% on room air. Slight accessory muscle use with deep inspiration.
goals: Reduce nighttime cough, improve exercise tolerance, decrease reliance on rescue inhaler.
biomechanical: Ribs 3-6 on the right with inhalation somatic dysfunction; thoracic kyphosis increased, T3-5 FRSr.
respiratory: Diaphragmatic excursion reduced; thoracic cage compliance decreased; lymphatic flow suboptimal.
metabolic: Mild seasonal allergies; sleep mildly fragmented; hydration adequate; nutrition balanced.
neurological: Increased sympathetic tone T1-T6; viscerosomatic reflexes noted right more than left.
behavioral: Stress related to graduate studies; inconsistent adherence to breathing exercises; motivated to learn self-care.
